Shamsher Singh Puri.translation: Just as paper perishes or decays when water falls on it, but when smeared with fat, tolerates the effect of water superbly.

Sant Sampuran Singh.translation: ijvyˆ kwgz pwxI dI iC`t pYˆidAwˆ gl jwˆdw hY pr jy kwgz nUM iGau nwl iQMDw kr id`qw jwvy qwˆ pwxI ivc gldw nhIˆ[

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy kot Bwr qUl qnk icng jrY; qyl myl dIpk mYN bwqI ibdmwn hY [

Shamsher Singh Puri.translation: Just as millions of bales of cotton get destroyed with a spark of fire, but when associated with oil as a wick, gives out light and lives longer.

Sant Sampuran Singh.translation: ijvyˆ kRoVwˆ gMFwˆ rUM dIAwˆ QoVI ijhI A`g dI cMigAwVI nwl J`t sV jwˆdIAwˆ hn, pr jy rUM b`qI bxw ky qyl nwl imlw ky dIvy ivc pw dyeIey qwˆ auh dyr qk mOjUd rihMdI hY[

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy loho bUf jwq sll mYN fwrq hI; kwst pRsMg gMg swgr n mwn hY [

Shamsher Singh Puri.translation: Just as iron sinks as soon as it is thrown in water, but when attached with wood, it floats and disregards the waters of river Ganges or even sea.

Sant Sampuran Singh.translation: ijvyˆ pwxI ivc pwauˆidAwˆ hI lohw fu`b jwˆdw hY pr l`kV dI sMgq nwl lohw gMgw qy swgr nUM fobxhwr nhIˆ mMndw Bwv qr jwˆdw hY[

lines.gurmukhi: qYsy jm kwl bÎwl sgl sMswr gRwsY; siqgur Bytq hI dwsn dswn hY [561[

Shamsher Singh Puri.translation: Similarly death-like snake is swallowing everyone. But once consecration from the Guru in the form of Naam is obtained, then the angel of death becomes slave of the slaves.  (561)

Sant Sampuran Singh.translation: iqvyˆ jmkwl rUpI Azdhw swry sMswr nUM f`sdw hY, pr siqgurU nUM imlidAwˆ hI auho jmkwl dwswˆ dw dws ho jwˆdw hY ]561]
